title.text: Machine Translation in the Financial Services Industry: a Case Study

abstractContent.text: The use of Machine Translation is spreading quickly in the translation industry.
While its implementation is smooth in some contexts, in the regulated services industry it certainly seems trickier.
In particular, the financial services industry can be considered a less conventional scenario within which to implement MT.

This paper explains how MT was successfully implemented in the workflow of a translation company specialized in financial services, and how freelance translators got positively involved in the process.

introductionContent.text: Welocalize Italy S.r.l. is Welocalize's Italian headquarter, based in Milan.
This hub used to be a translation company on its own and was recently merged into Welocalize to become its FSIspecialized translation hub.
The greater part of its business, since its foundation, has always been focused on the translation of financial, tax and legal documents.

entities.text: translation of financial, tax and legal documents

introductionContent.text: In order to stay in step with competitors and trends in the translation industry, and to offer a wider range of services and more flexibility to its customers, the company started thinking of implementing Machine Translation in its workflow.
In this paper we will describe how we implemented MT in this regulated sector.
